intro: Kalopanax septemlobus var. maximowiczii, commonly known as the Chinese seven-lobed cow-itch, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with seven to nine leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, followed by spiny, berry-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in botanical studies.
